DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether newly develop intervention feasible acceptable adolescent type 1 diabetes family diabetes care provider , evaluate trend whether intervention impact important diabetes outcome . The intervention involve diabetes care provider discuss reinforce individual ' family ' diabetes management strength routine , outpatient diabetes care appointment .
DOC.brief_title: Diabetes Strengths Study - Pilot Provider-delivered Strengths-based Intervention
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study pilot test newly develop strengths-based clinical intervention deliver diabetes care provider context routine ambulatory diabetes care , design promote resilience support diabetes management among adolescent type 1 diabetes family . The emphasis intervention shift tone clinical encounter diabetes care emphasize reinforce youth ' family ' current diabetes strength positive diabetes management behavior . Youth type 1 diabetes see routinely clinic every 3-4 month , intervention occur two consecutive clinic visit . The intervention consist ( A ) assess youth family diabetes strengths adherence prior visit , ( B ) training diabetes care provider tailor clinical encounter around reinforce patient family 's unique `` diabetes strengths profile '' generate strength adherence assessment . Outcome assessment conduct baseline ( prior start intervention ) immediately follow conclusion intervention ( approximately 6-8 month later ) . The primary outcome feasibility acceptability , measure qualitative feedback participant provider , well quantification recruitment enrollment , provider adherence intervention protocol , time completion . Secondary ( exploratory ) outcomes include diabetes regimen adherence , glycemic control , family conflict , diabetes burden , diabetes strength , satisfaction diabetes care provider relationship . Strengths adherence assessment also complete prior second clinic visit generate diabetes strength profile .
DOC.criteria: 1 . At least one parent adolescent , selfidentified primary caregiver involve diabetes care , also enrol adolescent participant . When present , secondary caregiver involve diabetes management invite ( require ) participate . 2 . Youth type 1 diabetes diagnosis least 12 month , allow ample opportunity adjustment diabetes management 3 . Youth parent fluency write spoken English assessment measure available language . ( 1 ) Presence serious mental illness developmental disability youth parent would impede participation would exclude eligibility .
